description: Redevelopment of site to provide a three storey building comprising ground floor office (B1a) with associated car parking; four x 2 bedroom self contained flats above, including roof terraces,  refuse and cycle storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Existing Sections, Elevations and Site Plan, Drawing No. 101/00/01, dated 05/07/2016; Existing East and West Elevations, Drawing No. 101/00/02, dated 05/07/2016; Proposed Ground Floor Office Plan, Drawing No. 101/00/03 - Revision A, dated 18/11/2016; Proposed First Floor Plan, Drawing No. 101/01/04 - Revision B, dated 01/12/2016; Proposed 2nd Floor Plan, Drawing No. 101/02/05 - Revision A, dated 18/11/2016; Proposed Roof Floor Plan, Drawing No. 101/04/07, dated 05/07/2016; Proposed East and West Elevations, Drawing No. 101/00/08 - Revision A, dated 18/11/2016; Proposed Sections and Elevations, Drawing No. 101/00/09 - Revision A, dated 18/11/2016; 1st Floor Distance from Habitable Rooms in Benjamin House, Drawing No. 101/00/12, dated 05/07/2016; 2nd Floor Distance from Habitable Rooms in Benjamin House, Drawing No. 101/00/13, dated 05/07/2016; Overlooking - Roof Floor, Drawing No. 101/00/14, dated 05/2016; Site Location Plan @ 1:500 Scale, Drawing No. 101/00/15, dated 05/07/2016; Proposed Roof High Level Plan, Drawing No. 101/04/16, dated 05/07/2016; Existing Ground Floor Office Plan, Drawing No. 101/00/17, dated 05/07/2016; Existing First Floor Plan, Drawing No. 101/00/18, dated 05/07/2016; Existing Roof Plan, Drawing No. 101/00/19, dated 05/07/2016; Surrounding Buildings Elevations, Drawing No. 101/00/40, dated 05/07/2016; Daylight and Sunlight Study - 1 Mount Place Acton, London W3 9DH, dated 04/07/2016; Design and Access Statement, Planning Statement - 1 Mount Place Acton, London W3 9DH, dated July 2016; Proposed East Elevation - Colour Render, Drawing No. 101/00/20, dated 07/07/2016; Proposed North Elevation - Colour Render, Drawing No. 101/00/21, dated 07/07/2016; Proposed South Elevation - Colour Render, Drawing No. 101/00/22, dated 07/07/2016; Colour Render - Upgraded Access Passage Axonometric View, Drawing No. 101/00/23, dated 07/07/2016; Colour Render - Mount Place Axonometric View, Drawing No. 101/00/24, dated 07/07/2016; Colour Render - First Floor Balcony Section, Drawing No. 101/00/25, dated 07/07/2016; Colour Render - First Floor AP1 Balcony View, Drawing No. 101/00/26, dated 07/07/2016; Colour Render - First Floor AP2 Balcony View, Drawing No. 101/00/27, dated 07/07/2016; Colour Render - First Floor AP3 Window View, Drawing No. 101/00/28, dated 07/07/2016; Colour Render - View from Acton High Street, Drawing No. 101/00/29, dated 07/07/2016; Colour Render - Gate Detail, Drawing No. 101/00/50, dated 07/07/2016; Colour Render - Plan, Drawing No. 101/00/51, dated 07/07/2016

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development herby approved is commenced. The details shall be fully implemented as approved.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015).

| Prior to occupation of the building, the details of a refuse management plan shall be submitted and approved, prior to the first occupation of the development. The refuse management plan shall demonstrate the commercial and residential refuse storage is separately located, and will demonstrate appropriate bin manoeuvrability for collection.

REASON:  In the interests of adequate refuse management of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policy 5.16.

| Before the development hereby permitted is brought into use, cycle parking and storage spaces as approved shall be implemented in accordance with the approved plans outlined in Condition 2. The cycle parking spaces and storage shall be fully implemented and thereafter permanently retained.

REASON: To ensure that the development provides an appropriate balance of transport options, reduce the likelihood of traffic congestion and does not adversely affect the safety of the road network, in accordance with policy 1.1 (f) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13.
| The roof area beyond the proposed roof terraces shall not be used as a storage area, balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.

REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015) and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

| Prior to occupation of the building, the roof landscaping shall be implemented as shown approved plans outlined in Condition 2. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

REASON:  To protect the visual character and appearance for neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 and 2.10, and policies 7.1, 7.2, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015).

| The rating noise level emitted from any proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

REASON: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
o	Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
o	Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
o	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.
| Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
o	the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors;
o	loading and unloading of plant and materials;
o	storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development;
o	the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate;
o	wheel washing facilities;
o	measures to control the emission of dust and dirt during demolition and construction; and
o	a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works
o	No encroachment on the clear space needed to maintain the safe and uninterrupted flow of road users and pedestrians;
o	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

o	The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

REASON: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2015 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.

| Insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the residential units shall be installed which meets an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), 0r NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use (A1/A2/A3).

REASON:  To protect amenity of the area in accordance with policies with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2015) policy 7.15.
| Any external lighting shall be designed to reduce light pollution to nearby residents, and road users and where applicable the recommendations of the following guidance shall be met:
o	ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011.
o	CIE Technical Report- Guide on the Limitation of the Effects of Obtrusive Light from Outdoor Lighting Installations - CIE 150: 2003.
o	Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report PLG05, Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements, 2015
o	Statutory Nuisance from Insects and Artificial Light by Department of Environment Food. Guidance on sections 101, 102 and 103 of the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005, Defra.

REASON:  To protect amenity of the area in accordance with policies with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2015) policy 7.15.

| Deliveries of goods to, and waste collections from the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.

REASON:  To protect amenity of the area in accordance with policies with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2015) policy 7.15. | Notwithstanding the provisions of the schedule of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2015, or in any provision equivalent to that class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), the commercial use onsite hereby approved shall not be subdivided without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To protect the vitality and viability of Acton Town Centre and surrounding employment uses in accordance with policies 1.1 (a) (d), 1.2 (c), and 2.1 (c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 2.15, 4.1, 4.7 and 4.8 of The London Plan 2015 and section 1 and 2 of the National Planning Policy Framework. | The commercial space hereby approved shall only be used as indicated on the approved plans (as outlined in Condition 2), and for no other purposes within the schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2015 or in any provision equivalent to that class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To protect the vitality and viability of Acton Town Centre in accordance with policies 1.1 (a) (d), 1.2 (c), and 3.1 (b) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 2.15, 4.1, 4.7 and 4.8 of The London Plan 2015 and section 1 and 2 of the National Planning Policy Framework.
